revealed_symptoms.telangiectasia: There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.
revealed_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.
revealed_symptoms.erythema: The skin around it looks red or puffy, like it’s irritated or reacting to something.
revealed_symptoms.asymmetry: One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
revealed_symptoms.spontaneous bleeding: Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
revealed_symptoms.border irregularity: The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles.

hidden_symptoms.pruritus: It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
hidden_symptoms.induration: It feels thicker or harder than the rest of my skin, like there's something under there.
hidden_symptoms.satellite lesions: There are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.
hidden_symptoms.color variation: It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.
hidden_symptoms.diameter >6mm: It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
hidden_symptoms.hyperkeratosis: There's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels.

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, there's this mole or bump that seems to have gotten bigger really fast. Also, the skin around it looks kind of red or puffy, and the edges are all jagged and messy. I've also noticed these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around it. Sometimes it just starts bleeding, even if I don’t touch it. And one side of the mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided.

Thank you for providing those details. Based on what you've described, I'd like to ask a few more questions to understand this further. Can you tell me, has the mole increased in size, and if so, how quickly? Also, have you noticed any itching around the mole, or is the area painful at all?
Yes, I told you, I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks. And yes, it's super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.

Thank you for the additional information. The rapid growth and itching are concerning. Has there been any change to the skin surrounding the mole, such as discoloration or the development of any new bumps or patches nearby? Also, do you have a family history of any kind of skin cancer?
There are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.
Thank you. The new spots are also very concerning. Have you experienced any pain in or around the mole? Has the area been exposed to a lot of sun recently, or experienced any kind of injury?
No, there hasn’t been any pain, and I don’t recall any injury or extra sun exposure.
Thank you. Do you have any family history of skin cancer? Also, have you experienced any other unusual changes to your skin recently, apart from the mole and surrounding spots?
No, I haven’t noticed anything else unusual.

doctor_history.content: Well, there's this mole or bump that seems to have gotten bigger really fast. Also, the skin around it looks kind of red or puffy, and the edges are all jagged and messy. I've also noticed these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around it. Sometimes it just starts bleeding, even if I don’t touch it. And one side of the mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided.
